title: Iran extends voting hours in snap election for a new president
content: For Iran’s ruling clerics, the public’s participation in elections is important to maintain the regime’s legitimacy, even as Iranians grow more disillusioned.
summary: For Iran’s ruling clerics, the public’s participation in elections is important to maintain the regime’s legitimacy, even as Iranians grow more disillusioned.

title: Orphaned as babies, these elephants returned to the wild amid bittersweet tears
content: Kapai and her herd were “rewilded” this month after years in an innovative Kenyan sanctuary, where keepers restored their health and prepared them to live free.
summary: Kapai and her herd were “rewilded” this month after years in an innovative Kenyan sanctuary, where keepers restored their health and prepared them to live free.

title: Homeland Security extends temporary protected status for Haitians
content: The expansion makes an additional 309,000 Haitians eligible for temporary protected status.
summary: The expansion makes an additional 309,000 Haitians eligible for temporary protected status.

title: How the world reacted to Biden’s ‘disastrous’ debate performance
content: If global leaders weren’t already hedging their bets about a future Trump presidency, they sure are now.
summary: If global leaders weren’t already hedging their bets about a future Trump presidency, they sure are now.

title: A weekend in Kharkiv: Beach, ping-pong, poetry jams, Russian bombs
content: As Russia pummels Ukraine’s second-largest city with glide bombs, Kharkiv is relishing the rituals of early summer, which residents say, is a form of resistance.
summary: As Russia pummels Ukraine’s second-largest city with glide bombs, Kharkiv is relishing the rituals of early summer, which residents say, is a form of resistance.

title: Monsoon rains collapse roof at New Delhi airport, crushing cars and killing 1
content: India has seen an infrastructure boom to meet rising demands for transportation, but there have been criticisms about poor maintenance and oversight of building.
summary: India has seen an infrastructure boom to meet rising demands for transportation, but there have been criticisms about poor maintenance and oversight of building.

title: Why China’s Communist Party expelled two former defense ministers
content: The tough language in the expulsion announcement suggests Chinese leader Xi Jinping is not done with his effort to ensure total loyalty in the world’s largest army.
summary: The tough language in the expulsion announcement suggests Chinese leader Xi Jinping is not done with his effort to ensure total loyalty in the world’s largest army.

title: Post publisher’s role in hacking response comes into sharper focus
content: Former U.K. prime minister Gordon Brown calls for William Lewis to be criminally investigated. Lewis says he “did nothing wrong.”
summary: Former U.K. prime minister Gordon Brown calls for William Lewis to be criminally investigated. Lewis says he “did nothing wrong.”

title: In France’s rebranded far right, flashes of antisemitism and racism persist
content: Ahead of French elections, vitriol and innuendo from National Rally candidates amplify doubts about how much the party of Marine Le Pen has truly evolved.
summary: Ahead of French elections, vitriol and innuendo from National Rally candidates amplify doubts about how much the party of Marine Le Pen has truly evolved.

title: The French far right is leading in election polls. Here’s what to know.
content: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.
summary: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.

title: The twilight of Macronism
content: In the upcoming parliamentary elections in France, no realistic scenario looks good for French President Emmanuel Macron.
summary: In the upcoming parliamentary elections in France, no realistic scenario looks good for French President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Critically ill children leave Gaza in first evacuation in weeks
content: The evacuation was coordinated by Israel, Egypt and the United States and followed weeks of pressure on Israel to allow sick Palestinians to leave the enclave.
summary: The evacuation was coordinated by Israel, Egypt and the United States and followed weeks of pressure on Israel to allow sick Palestinians to leave the enclave.

title: Gazans flee homes ahead of new Israeli operation in northern neighborhood
content: An Israel Defense Forces soldier was killed in Jenin, in the West Bank, when his vehicle was hit by a buried explosive, Israeli forces and media reported.
summary: An Israel Defense Forces soldier was killed in Jenin, in the West Bank, when his vehicle was hit by a buried explosive, Israeli forces and media reported.

title: Iran is picking a new president. Here’s what to know.
content: Four men are now running for president in Friday’s vote. Only one is considered a reformist.
summary: Four men are now running for president in Friday’s vote. Only one is considered a reformist.

title: U.S. to receive first new pandas in 20 years after farewell party in China
content: Pandas Yun Chuan and Xin Bao will set up home at the San Diego Zoo in California. An elaborate farewell ceremony was held in their honor in Sichuan, China.
summary: Pandas Yun Chuan and Xin Bao will set up home at the San Diego Zoo in California. An elaborate farewell ceremony was held in their honor in Sichuan, China.

title: China says U.S. can’t stop it from taking ‘giant steps’ in space
content: China is the first country to retrieve rocks from the far side of the moon, which experts say could be a game changer in understanding lunar history.
summary: China is the first country to retrieve rocks from the far side of the moon, which experts say could be a game changer in understanding lunar history.

title: Neanderthal community cared for child with Down syndrome, fossil suggests
content: The bone of a 6-year-old found in Spain’s Valencia region provides evidence of communal care by Neanderthals, researchers say, and maybe even compassion.
summary: The bone of a 6-year-old found in Spain’s Valencia region provides evidence of communal care by Neanderthals, researchers say, and maybe even compassion.

title: A world-first emissions tax is going after gassy cattle
content: Denmark’s bill, which has broad consensus support, targets greenhouse gases emitted by the country’s cows, pigs and sheep. New Zealand axed plans for a similar tax.
summary: Denmark’s bill, which has broad consensus support, targets greenhouse gases emitted by the country’s cows, pigs and sheep. New Zealand axed plans for a similar tax.

title: What an election betting scandal says about British politics and culture
content: At least five Conservative officials are being investigated by Britain’s gambling watchdog as part of a probe into their placing bets on the timing of the British general election, which is set for July 4.
summary: At least five Conservative officials are being investigated by Britain’s gambling watchdog as part of a probe into their placing bets on the timing of the British general election, which is set for July 4.

title: Bolivian soldiers storm plaza; former general accused of coup attempt
content: A dismissed former Army general was accused of leading an uprising. President Luis Arce denounced the “irregular” troop movements in Plaza Murillo and said “democracy must be respected.”
summary: A dismissed former Army general was accused of leading an uprising. President Luis Arce denounced the “irregular” troop movements in Plaza Murillo and said “democracy must be respected.”

title: U.S. war aid of $6.5 billion discussed during ‘productive’ Gallant visit
content: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant attempted to smooth turbulent public relations with Washington, amid conversations on military assistance and a transition to lower-intensity operations in Gaza.
summary: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant attempted to smooth turbulent public relations with Washington, amid conversations on military assistance and a transition to lower-intensity operations in Gaza.
